I loved October Sky. The thing I loved most had to be the music. It worked two ways: in the first hour of the film, it gives off a sense of yearning and excitement about unexplored futures. Which corresponded with the lead character Halie Coulter’s motivations as a young boy to become like his role model, a Russian rocket scientist. The music of October Sky is cleverly chosen because it builds up intensity and desire and necessity for change.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century.
